alert.note: Alert for Caledonia; Eastern Addison; Eastern Chittenden; Eastern Franklin; Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Essex; Lamoille; Orange; Orleans; Washington; Western Rutland; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 22 at 4:23AM EST until November 22 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Mixed wintry precipitation expected to continue for portions of the North Country with additional accumulations of snow or ice being generally less than 1 inch or a few hundredths respectively. Untreated road surfaces will continue to be icy this morning even where snow and freezing rain have transitioned to rain. Winds gusting as high as 25 mph. * WHERE...All of northern New York. All of central and northern Vermont except the immediate Champlain Valley and Champlain Islands. * WHEN...Through 1 PM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery and icy road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning commute today in many areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A weather system will continue to bring mixed wintry precipitation this morning. Difficult travel conditions are expected from snow and ice accumulation on one of the busiest travel days of the year. Icy conditions continue even where the wintry mix has transitioned to all rain given cold ground temperatures. Any additional snow accumulations will be limited to less than 2 inches and ice to only a trace to few hundredths of an inch mainly for higher elevations.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Please allow extra time if travel is necessary.

area.areaDesc: Caledonia; Eastern Addison; Eastern Chittenden; Eastern Franklin; Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Essex; Lamoille; Orange; Orleans; Washington; Western Rutland; Western Windsor
